model.chip_description: Product Features • ARM Cortex-M CPU platform • High Performance 32-bit processor @ up to 48 MHz • Memory Protection Unit • Wake-up Interrupt Controller • Flexible Energy Management System • General Purpose I/O pins • Configurable Push-pull, Open-drain, pull-up/down, input filter, drive strength • Configurable peripheral I/O locations • asynchronous external interrupts • Multi Channel DMA Controller • Multi Channel Peripheral Reflex System for autonomous inter-peripheral signaling • Hardware AES with 128/256-bit keys in 54/75 cycles • Timers/Counters • 16-bit Timer/Counters • 3×3 Compare/Capture/PWM channels • Dead-Time Insertion on TIMER0 • 16-bit Low Energy Timer • 24-bit Real-Time Counter • 8-bit Pulse Counters • Asynchronous pulse counting/quadrature decoding • Watchdog Timer with dedicated RC oscillator @ 50 nA • Integrated LCD Controller for up to 4×40 segments • Voltage boost, adjustable contrast adjustment and autonomous animation feature • External Bus Interface for up to 64 MB of external memory mapped space • Communication interfaces • Universal Synchronous/Asynchronous Receiver/ Transmitter • UART/SPI/SmartCard (ISO 7816)/IrDA • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 4-16 data bits • Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 8-9 data bits • Low Energy UART • Autonomous operation with DMA in Deep Sleep Mode • I2C Interface with SMBus support • Address recognition in Stop Mode • Ultra low power precision analog peripherals • 12-bit 1 Msamples/s Analog to Digital Converter • 8 single ended channels/4 differential channels • On-chip temperature sensor • Conversion tailgating for predictable latency • 12-bit 500 ksamples/s Digital to Analog Converter • 2 single ended channels/1 differential channel • 2× Analog Comparator • Programmable speed/current • Capacitive sensing with up to 8 inputs • Supply Voltage Comparator • Ultra efficient Power-on Reset and Brown-Out Detector • 2-pin Serial Wire Debug interface • 1-pin Serial Wire Viewer • Pre-Programmed Serial Bootloader • Temperature range -40 to 85 ºC • Single power supply 1.8 to 3.8 V (C) Copyright Silicon Laboratories, Inc. 2015. All rights reserved.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, WS0 - Zero wait-states inserted in fetch or read transfers. 0x01, WS1 - One wait-state inserted for each fetch or read transfer. This mode is required for a core frequency above 16 MHz. 0x02, WS0SCBTP - Zero wait-states inserted with the Suppressed Conditional Branch Target Prefetch (SCBTP) function enabled. SCBTP saves energy by delaying the Cortex' conditional branch target prefetches until the conditional branch instruction is in the execute stage. When the instruction reaches this stage, the evaluation of the branch condition is completed and the core does not perform a speculative prefetch of both the branch target address and the next sequential address. With the SCBTP function enabled, one instruction fetch is saved for each branch not taken, with a negligible performance penalty. 0x03, WS1SCBTP - One wait-state access with SCBTP enabled.

field.description: Brown Out Detector Unregulated Domain Reset

field.description: Brown Out Detector Regulated Domain Reset

field.name: HFXOMODE
field.description: HFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 4-32 MHz crystal oscillator. 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with HFXTAL_N, suitable for external sine wave (4-32 MHz). The sine wave should have a minimum of 200 mV peak to peak. 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on HFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: HFXOBOOST
field.description: HFXO Start-up Boost Current - Value, Description 0x00, 50PCENT - 50 %. 0x01, 70PCENT - 70 %. 0x02, 80PCENT - 80 %. 0x03, 100PCENT - 100 % (default).

field.name: HFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: HFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles. 0x01, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles. 0x02, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles. 0x03, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles.

field.name: LFXOMODE
field.description: LFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 32.768 kHz crystal oscillator. 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with LFXTAL_N pin, suitable for external sinus wave (32.768 kHz). 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on LFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: LFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: LFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles. 0x01, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles. 0x02, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles. 0x03, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles.

field.name: CLKOUTSEL0
field.description: Clock Output Select 0 - Value, Description 0x00, HFRCO - HFRCO (directly from oscillator). 0x01, HFXO - HFXO (directly from oscillator). 0x02, HFCLK2 - HFCLK/2. 0x03, HFCLK4 - HFCLK/4. 0x04, HFCLK8 - HFCLK/8. 0x05, HFCLK16 - HFCLK/16. 0x06, ULFRCO - ULFRCO (directly from oscillator). 0x07, AUXHFRCO - AUXHFRCO (directly from oscillator).

field.name: CLKOUTSEL1
field.description: Clock Output Select 1 - Value, Description 0x00, LFRCO - LFRCO (directly from oscillator). 0x01, LFXO - LFXO (directly from oscillator). 0x02, HFCLK - HFCLK. 0x03, LFXOQ - LFXO (qualified). 0x04, HFXOQ - HFXO (qualified). 0x05, LFRCOQ - LFRCO (qualified). 0x06, HFRCOQ - HFRCO (qualified). 0x07, AUXHFRCOQ - AUXHFRCO (qualified).

field.name: HFCORECLKDIV
field.description: HFCORECLK Divider - Value, Description 0x00, HFCLK - HFCORECLK = HFCLK. 0x01, HFCLK2 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/2. 0x02, HFCLK4 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/4. 0x03, HFCLK8 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/8. 0x04, HFCLK16 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/16. 0x05, HFCLK32 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/32. 0x06, HFCLK64 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/64. 0x07, HFCLK128 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/128. 0x08, HFCLK256 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/256. 0x09, HFCLK512 - HFCORECLK = HFCLK/512.

register.name: HFPERCLKDIV
register.description: High Frequency Peripheral Clock Division Register

field.name: HFPERCLKDIV
field.description: HFPERCLK Divider - Value, Description 0x00, HFCLK - HFPERCLK = HFCLK. 0x01, HFCLK2 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/2. 0x02, HFCLK4 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/4. 0x03, HFCLK8 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/8. 0x04, HFCLK16 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/16. 0x05, HFCLK32 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/32. 0x06, HFCLK64 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/64. 0x07, HFCLK128 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/128. 0x08, HFCLK256 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/256. 0x09, HFCLK512 - HFPERCLK = HFCLK/512.

field.name: BAND
field.description: HFRCO Band Select - Value, Description 0x00, 1MHZ - 1 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x01, 7MHZ - 7 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x02, 11MHZ - 11 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x03, 14MHZ - 14 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x04, 21MHZ - 21 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x05, 28MHZ - 28 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band.

field.name: BAND
field.description: AUXHFRCO Band Select - Value, Description 0x00, 14MHZ - 14 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x01, 11MHZ - 11 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x02, 7MHZ - 7 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x03, 1MHZ - 1 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x06, 28MHZ - 28 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x07, 21MHZ - 21 MHz band. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band.

field.name: UPSEL
field.description: Calibration Up-counter Select - Value, Description 0x00, HFXO - Select HFXO as up-counter. 0x01, LFXO - Select LFXO as up-counter. 0x02, HFRCO - Select HFRCO as up-counter. 0x03, LFRCO - Select LFRCO as up-counter. 0x04, AUXHFRCO - Select AUXHFRCO as up-counter.

field.name: DOWNSEL
field.description: Calibration Down-counter Select - Value, Description 0x00, HFCLK - Select HFCLK for down-counter. 0x01, HFXO - Select HFXO for down-counter. 0x02, LFXO - Select LFXO for down-counter. 0x03, HFRCO - Select HFRCO for down-counter. 0x04, LFRCO - Select LFRCO for down-counter. 0x05, AUXHFRCO - Select AUXHFRCO for down-counter.

field.name: HFCLKSEL
field.description: HFCLK Select - Value, Description 0x01, HFRCO - Select HFRCO as HFCLK. 0x02, HFXO - Select HFXO as HFCLK. 0x03, LFRCO - Select LFRCO as HFCLK. 0x04, LFXO - Select LFXO as HFCLK.

field.name: LFA
field.description: Clock Select for LFA - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - LFACLK is disabled 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as LFACLK 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as LFACLK 0x03, HFCORECLKLEDIV2 - HFCORECLKLE divided by two or four is selected as LFACLK. The division factor is determined by CMU_CTRL_HFLE and CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKLEDIV.

field.name: LFB
field.description: Clock Select for LFB - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - LFBCLK is disabled 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as LFBCLK 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as LFBCLK 0x03, HFCORECLKLEDIV2 - HFCORECLKLE divided by two or four is selected as LFACLK. The division factor is determined by CMU_CTRL_HFLE and CMU_HFCORECLKDIV_HFCORECLKLEDIV.

field.description: Real-Time Counter Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/4 0x03, DIV8 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/8 0x04, DIV16 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/16 0x05, DIV32 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/32 0x06, DIV64 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/64 0x07, DIV128 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/128 0x08, DIV256 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/256 0x09, DIV512 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/512 0x0A, DIV1024 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/1024 0x0B, DIV2048 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/2048 0x0C, DIV4096 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/4096 0x0D, DIV8192 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/8192 0x0E, DIV16384 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/16384 0x0F, DIV32768 - LFACLKRTC = LFACLK/32768

field.name: LETIMER0

register.name: LFBPRESC0
register.description: Low Frequency B Prescaler Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: LEUART0
field.description: Low Energy UART 0 Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/4 0x03, DIV8 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/8

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Configuration Lock Key - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0580E, UNLOCK -

field.name: SCANMODE
field.description: Configure scan mode - Value, Description 0x00, PERIODIC - A new scan is started each time the period counter overflows 0x01, ONESHOT - A single scan is performed when START in CMD is set 0x02, PRS - Pulse on PRS channel

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Scan start PRS select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input

field.name: SCANCONF
field.description: Select scan configuration - Value, Description 0x00, DIRMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are directly mapped to the channel number. 0x01, INVMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are CHX+8_CONF for channels 0-7 and CHX-8_CONF for channels 8-15. 0x02, TOGGLE - The channel configuration register registers used toggles between CHX_CONF and CHX+8_CONF when channel x triggers 0x03, DECDEF - The decoder state defines the CONF registers to be used.

field.name: BUFIDL
field.description: Result buffer interrupt and DMA trigger level

field.name: DMAWU
field.description: DMA wake-up from EM2 - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - No DMA wake-up from EM2 0x01, BUFDATAV - DMA wake-up from EM2 when data is valid in the result buffer 0x02, BUFLEVEL - DMA wake-up from EM2 when the result buffer is full/half-full depending on BUFIDL configuration

field.name: AUXPRESC
field.description: Prescaling factor for high frequency timer - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/1 0x01, DIV2 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/2 0x02, DIV4 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/4 0x03, DIV8 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/8

field.name: LFPRESC
field.description: Prescaling factor for low frequency timer - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/1 0x01, DIV2 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/2 0x02, DIV4 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/4 0x03, DIV8 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/8 0x04, DIV16 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/16 0x05, DIV32 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/32 0x06, DIV64 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/64 0x07, DIV128 - Low frequency timer is clocked with LFACLKLESENSE/128

field.name: PCPRESC
field.description: Period counter prescaling - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/1 0x01, DIV2 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/2 0x02, DIV4 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/4 0x03, DIV8 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/8 0x04, DIV16 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/16 0x05, DIV32 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/32 0x06, DIV64 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/64 0x07, DIV128 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/128

field.name: DACCH0CONV
field.description: DAC channel 0 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH0. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 0 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH1CONV
field.description: DAC channel 1 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH1. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 1 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH0OUT
field.description: DAC channel 0 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH0 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH0 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: DACCH1OUT
field.description: DAC channel 1 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH1 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH1 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: ACMP0MODE
field.description: ACMP0 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP0 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP0 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP0

field.name: ACMP1MODE
field.description: ACMP1 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP1 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP1 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP1

field.name: WARMUPMODE
field.description: ACMP and DAC duty cycle mode - Value, Description 0x00, NORMAL - The analog comparators and DAC are shut down when LESENSE is idle 0x01, KEEPACMPWARM - The analog comparators are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x02, KEEPDACWARM - The DAC is kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x03, KEEPACMPDACWARM - The analog comparators and DAC are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle

field.name: INTMAP
field.description: Enable decoder to channel interrupt mapping

field.name: HYSTPRS0
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS0 output

field.name: HYSTPRS1
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS1 output

field.name: HYSTPRS2
field.description: Enable decoder hysteresis on PRS2 output

field.name: HYSTIRQ

field.name: PRSCNT

field.name: BIASMODE

field.name: SETIF
field.description: Enable interrupt generation - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No interrupt is generated 0x01, LEVEL - Set interrupt flag if the sensor triggers. 0x02, POSEDGE - Set interrupt flag on positive edge on the sensor state 0x03, NEGEDGE - Set interrupt flag on negative edge on the sensor state

field.name: EXMODE
field.description: Set GPIO mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Disabled 0x01, HIGH - Push Pull, GPIO is driven high 0x02, LOW - Push Pull, GPIO is driven low 0x03, DACOUT - DAC output

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX Delay Transmission - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Frames are transmitted immediately 0x01, SINGLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by a single baud period 0x02, DOUBLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by two baud periods 0x03, TRIPLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by three baud periods

field.name: AUTOTX
field.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

field.name: DATABITS
field.description: Data-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x01, FOUR - Each frame contains 4 data bits 0x02, FIVE - Each frame contains 5 data bits 0x03, SIX - Each frame contains 6 data bits 0x04, SEVEN - Each frame contains 7 data bits 0x05, EIGHT - Each frame contains 8 data bits 0x06, NINE - Each frame contains 9 data bits 0x07, TEN - Each frame contains 10 data bits 0x08, ELEVEN - Each frame contains 11 data bits 0x09, TWELVE - Each frame contains 12 data bits 0x0A, THIRTEEN - Each frame contains 13 data bits 0x0B, FOURTEEN - Each frame contains 14 data bits 0x0C, FIFTEEN - Each frame contains 15 data bits 0x0D, SIXTEEN - Each frame contains 16 data bits

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: STOPBITS
field.description: Stop-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, HALF - The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver 0x01, ONE - One stop bit is generated and verified 0x02, ONEANDAHALF - The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit 0x03, TWO - The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

field.name: ICEDGE
field.description: Input Capture Edge Select - Value, Description 0x00, RISING - Rising edges detected 0x01, FALLING - Falling edges detected 0x02, BOTH - Both edges detected 0x03, NONE - No edge detection, signal is left as it is

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.description: CC Channel Mode - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Compare/Capture channel turned off 0x01, INPUTCAPTURE - Input capture 0x02, OUTPUTCOMPARE - Output compare 0x03, PWM - Pulse-Width Modulation

field.description: Edge Detect Select - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Signal is left as it is 0x01, POSEDGE - A one HFPERCLK cycle pulse is generated for every positive edge of the incoming signal 0x02, NEGEDGE - A one HFPERCLK clock cycle pulse is generated for every negative edge of the incoming signal 0x03, BOTHEDGES - A one HFPERCLK clock cycle pulse is generated for every edge of the incoming signal

field.name: SOURCESEL
field.description: Source Select - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No source selected 0x01, VCMP - Voltage Comparator 0x02, ACMP0 - Analog Comparator 0 0x03, ACMP1 - Analog Comparator 1 0x011, USART1 - Universal Synchronous/Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter 1 0x01C, TIMER0 - Timer 0 0x01D, TIMER1 - Timer 1 0x028, RTC - Real-Time Counter 0x030, GPIOL - General purpose Input/Output 0x031, GPIOH - General purpose Input/Output 0x034, LETIMER0 - Low Energy Timer 0 0x039, LESENSEL - Low Energy Sensor Interface 0x03A, LESENSEH - Low Energy Sensor Interface 0x03B, LESENSED - Low Energy Sensor Interface

field.name: EDSEL
field.description: Edge Detect Select - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Signal is left as it is 0x01, POSEDGE - A one HFPERCLK cycle pulse is generated for every positive edge of the incoming signal 0x02, NEGEDGE - A one HFPERCLK clock cycle pulse is generated for every negative edge of the incoming signal 0x03, BOTHEDGES - A one HFPERCLK clock cycle pulse is generated for every edge of the incoming signal

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX Delay Transmission - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Frames are transmitted immediately 0x01, SINGLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by a single baud period 0x02, DOUBLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by two baud periods 0x03, TRIPLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by three baud periods

register.name: RXDATAXP
register.description: Receive Buffer Data Extended Peek Register

field.name: MPAF
field.description: Set Multi-Processor Address Frame Interrupt Flag

field.name: MPAF
field.description: Clear Multi-Processor Address Frame Interrupt Flag

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3 0x04, LOC4 - Location 4

field.name: RXPRSSEL
field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: REPMODE
field.description: Repeat Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FREE - When started, the LETIMER counts down until it is stopped by software. 0x01, ONESHOT - The counter counts REP0 times. When REP0 reaches zero, the counter stops. 0x02, BUFFERED - The counter counts REP0 times. If REP1 has been written, it is loaded into REP0 when REP0 reaches zero. Else the counter stops 0x03, DOUBLE - Both REP0 and REP1 are decremented when the LETIMER wraps around. The LETIMER counts until both REP0 and REP1 are zero

field.name: UFOA0
field.description: Underflow Output Action 0 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O0 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O0 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O0 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O0 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: UFOA1
field.description: Underflow Output Action 1 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O1 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O1 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O1 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O1 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: MODE
field.description: Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - The module is disabled. 0x01, OVSSINGLE - Single input LFACLK oversampling mode (available in EM0-EM2). 0x02, EXTCLKSINGLE - Externally clocked single input counter mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x03, EXTCLKQUAD - Externally clocked quadrature decoder mode (available in EM0-EM3).

field.name: CNTEV
field.description: Controls when the counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, BOTH - Counts up on up-count and down on down-count events. 0x01, UP - Only counts up on up-count events. 0x02, DOWN - Only counts down on down-count events. 0x03, NONE - Never counts.

field.name: AUXCNTEV
field.description: Controls when the auxiliary counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Never counts. 0x01, UP - Counts up on up-count events. 0x02, DOWN - Counts up on down-count events. 0x03, BOTH - Counts up on both up-count and down-count events.

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: S0PRSSEL
field.description: S0IN PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected. 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected. 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected. 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected. 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected. 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected. 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected. 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected.

field.name: S1PRSSEL
field.description: S1IN PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected. 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected. 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected. 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected. 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected. 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected. 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected. 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected.

field.name: CLHR
field.description: Clock Low High Ratio - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 4:4 0x01, ASYMMETRIC - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 6:3 0x02, FAST - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 11:6

field.name: BITO
field.description: Bus Idle Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

field.name: GIBITO
field.description: Go Idle on Bus Idle Timeout

field.name: CLTO
field.description: Clock Low Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout. 0x04, 320PPC - Timeout after 320 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout. 0x05, 1024PPC - Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

field.name: STATE
field.description: Transmission State - Value, Description 0x00, IDLE - No transmission is being performed. 0x01, WAIT - Waiting for idle. Will send a start condition as soon as the bus is idle. 0x02, START - Start transmitted or received 0x03, ADDR - Address transmitted or received 0x04, ADDRACK - Address ack/nack transmitted or received 0x05, DATA - Data transmitted or received 0x06, DATAACK - Data ack/nack transmitted or received
